Introduction
I'm a biologist interested in biodiversity, particularly in its cataloging and description (taxonomy) and processes that created it (speciation, phylogeny). My focus is primarily on ant diversity and evolution, and in my research I combine field work, morphology, molecular phylogenetics, and comparative methods. I'm also interested in computational biology and best practices in phylogeny estimation from high-throughput sequencing data.

Two species of myrmecophilous Diapriidae (Hymenoptera) new to Poland
Article
Full-text available
  • Jan 2013
  • Marek Borowiec
Solenopsia imitatrix and Trichopria inquilina found in nests of Solenopsis fugax are recorded for the first time from Poland and briefly characterized. Notes on their biology, identification, and distribution are given. Colour habitus photographs of both species are also provided.
